page.title: 10Bassenthwaite Groups/Clubs
page.content: {YOUTH CLUB_}22 people go to the Youth club aged 11 to 17. The vicar runs it. The members pay 10p. weekly, which goes to the Club funds.They play games such as pool and darts. This year they are going to organise trips. The Club runs from 7.00p.m. to 9.00p.m. on Fridays.{TODDLER'S GROUP-}There are 18 children. The group is run by mothers. The children go from birth to school age. It is on Wednesdays, 1.00p.m. to 3.15p.m. The group started in 1980 in people's houses.Then they moved to the Parishroom, and then to the Church Room. They have a raffle every week. They get Â£50 a year from the Parish Council.{SAILING CLUB-}This was opened in 1952 by the Duke of Edinburgh.About 55 members own 175 boats.Open days are held each year to encourage people to join. There are two lifeboats run by local people.
